title: How to communicate with people who constantly go on their phone - Quora

response.answer_text: HA! I see this all the time.  I stop talking and when they hear the silence and look up from their pocket G-d, I politely tell them.  Oh I'll wait until you're finished or you can catch me later when you're not so busy.  They usually put the stupid phone down. If they don't, I just wave at them and mouth.."Later when you have time" and Walk away.  I find it rude, in fact if I'm in a meeting. I take out my phone and either 1. Turn it off and put it in my pocket so that I can give my 100% attention to my meeting and the PEOPLE IN IT . or  2. If my kids are not at home or something along that line where you actually DO have to be available. I say: "I'm expecting a call on a personal matter, so sorry" "or waiting for a call from my kids nurse" or whatever it is if its important enough to be waiting on it and then I only check it if it vibrates.  WHEN IT DOES, I say "Excuse me please. Check the phone, and then get up and leave the table for the conversation if it the call I'm waiting for.  If not, I just apologize and continue the meeting.   If it doesn't vibrate I don't "double check it" , I'm paying attention to the people I'm meeting.  On one hand it is mere manners, I'm meeting with business people who value their time and I VALUE their time. It's just respect.  Secondly, I'm not so ego driven. The world will go on spinning if I don't spring back onto the phone within seconds of someone calling me.

You could text them while they're right in front of you.  Another idea is to start throwing random comments at them, sometimes ending with a questioning uplift to your voice, just to see if they'll make themselves look stupid by agreeing with whatever absurdity you just said.
